message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a novel approach to Reinforcement Learning using Recurrent Convolutional Neural Networks (RCNNs). RCNNs are a combination of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), which are commonly used in computer vision and natural language processing tasks. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely categories for this paper. 

The paper also presents a robot planning problem, which involves partially observable environments, and the proposed RCNNs are designed to handle such environments. Therefore, cs.RO (Robotics) is another likely category. 

The paper uses CNNs to extract features from the environment and RNNs to propagate beliefs of state in partially observable environments. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is another possible category. 

Finally, the paper proposes a model-based approach to RL, where the RCNNs learn the Transition Model and Reward Function associated with the underlying MDP. Therefore, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is another possible category.
